alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 8:33PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Greenbrier, southeastern Summers and central Monroe Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 833 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buck, or 7 miles southeast of Hinton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ronceverte... Alderson... Union... Red Sulphur Spring... Laurel Branch... Pickaway... and Buck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
